intro: Astrebla pectinata var. curvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf Mitchell grass, is a perennial grass native to Australia. It is characterized by its slender, curved leaves and is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has a fibrous root system that helps it survive in harsh, dry environments. It is an important component of native grasslands and provides forage for livestock. Its growth is often associated with well-drained soils and is adapted to periodic drought conditions.
